subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Calculated Bets: How Founders Evaluate Odds
description: A short lesson to help you apply Calculated Bets: How Founders Evaluate Odds.

hook.text: Jeff Bezos quit a Wall Street VP job to sell books online. He gave Amazon a 30% chance of working.

buildup.text: Smart founders don't ignore riskâ€”they quantify regret. Bezos used a 'regret minimization framework.'

discovery.text: The framework asks: at age 80, will I regret not trying? If yes, the asymmetry favors action.

twist.text: Most people overestimate the cost of failure and underestimate the cost of inaction.

climax.text: Bezos calculated that even if Amazon failed, he'd be proud of trying. The downside was survivable.

punchline.text: The biggest risk is the one you never take.

quiz.question: What is Bezos's regret minimization framework?
options: Choosing the path you'd least regret at age 80
Calculating exact financial odds before deciding
Minimizing losses in every business decision
